rComments: I don't see what these people are getting on about.  While I think John Jordan seems like a nice man, his lectures are all the same, and are all equally tedious.  Perhaps the class is far too big, and I am far too critical.  Also, he's the spitting image of Ron Paul.

Jordan was EXTREMELY excited and animated about the material (Detective Fiction). Did a nice job of providing mostly useful and entertaining lectures. Reasonable academic workload paper-wise, but reading-wise... TOO MANY BOOKS ASSIGNED! Overall, he's a pretty adorable little man (very reminiscent of Mr. Rogers...)

Professor Jordan is the best professor I've had at UCSC (after seven quarters). The lectures are always interesting, John is extremely animated and enthusiastic, and the books are fantastic.  The reading load is admittedly kind of heavy, but when you're reading Sherlock Holmes it doesn't seem like a chore.  HIGHLY recommended!
South African Literature. Very labor intensive course. 3 papers, required sections. Must read all texts or you will fail. John is great, he will prepare you for a real degree!

John Jordan is sweet old man with a smile on his face 95% of the time. He reminds me of Mr. Rogers. Keep in mind that this class was a little unusual, as it was a weeklong program over the summer. Still, you get five credits and anybody can do it. Students could make the lamest, most useless comments & he'd be smiling like their ideas were awesome.
